newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: POSCO in $120 mln Indonesia venture.
newsitem.headline: POSCO in $120 mln Indonesia venture.

text.p: South Korea's Pohang Iron and Steel Co (POSCO) said on Thursday the company and Jakarta-based PT Metro had agreed in principle to build a $120 million cold-rolled stainless steel plant in Indonesia.
POSCO said in a statement it would have a 70 percent stake in the venture and PT Metro the remainder.
It said the feasibility study was expected to be completed by early 1997 and a contract to be officially signed in late February 1997.
The plant will have an annual production capacity of 75,000 tonnes and the construction was expected to start in the second half of 1997, it said.
At present Indonesia has no production capacity for cold-rolled stainless steel and relies entirely on imports.
The nation imported 52,000 tonnes of cold-rolled stainless steel in 1995 and demand is expected to grow by 10 percent annually in the next couple of years, the statement said.
